result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevin Rudy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court has no objection to serving probation out of State if it us thru Department of Corrections.

miscConds.notes: To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.

-Full time employment.
-Mental Health assessment.
-Sex Offender treatment assessment.
-No Contact with the victim and her family.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court will allow travel to Indiana prior to the interstate compact being approved.

timeConds.notes: Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  NO Huber.  If defendant finds a job, and gets everything lined up, the court will review huber.

records.addlTxt:
2:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Amy Menzel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Menzel has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by Tracy Danielson.  Sentencing argument by ADA Vanden Branden.  Sentencing argument by Atty Menzel.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 5 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

-6 months county jail.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  NO Huber.  If defendant finds a job, and gets everything lined up, the court will review huber.
-Full time employment.
-Mental Health assessment.
-Sex Offender treatment assessment.
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-No Contact with the victim and her family.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court has no objection to serving probation out of State if it us thru Department of Corrections.
Court will allow travel to Indiana prior to the interstate compact being approved.

Court adjourned at 2:22 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on June 20, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 20, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
from Atty Amy L. Menzel dated May 26, 2017 re: PSI
from Agent Michael Pulice dated 05/23/2017 re: order for PSI
Sentencing hearing on June 20, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
from Agent Michael Pulice dated April 11, 2017 re: request for additional 45 days to complete the PSI (approved by the Court)

Atty Menzel called in regards to the PSI, the order for PSI got lost someplace via electronic between here and wherever it goes and the agent assigned will not have enough time to get it completed by the sentencing date.  Informed Atty Menzel that I would wait for the request for more time, and would rescheduled after the Court's approval.

43
Sentencing hearing on May 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

11:35 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Amy Menzel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA recites agreement - defendant will plea to an amended charge of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault in violation of 940.225(3) with a Presentence investigation.  Atty Menzel concurs.  Defendant concurs.  ADA moves to amend to 3rd degree sexual assault in violation of 940.225(3), a class G felony.  ADA Vanden Branden confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Atty Menzel waives reading of amended charge.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended count 1.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days.  Upon filing, copies to be disbursed.  Court sets for Sentencing on May 9, 2017 at 1:30 p.m.  

Court adjourned at 11:43 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 14, 2017 at 11:30 am.

1:34 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Amy Menzel present via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Menzel - have emailed the results of the defendant's psychco sexual evaluation to ADA Vanden Branden.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on February 14, 2017 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:36 p.m.

2:51 p.m. Attorney Amy Lynn Menzel in court by phone.  Lisa Vanden Branden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Menzel states they are close to a resolution. COURT schedules Status hearing for January 3, 2017 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:53 p.m.
Status hearing on January 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:06 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Amy Menzel present via telephone.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Menzel - need a little more time for defendant to complete the assessment.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 22, 2016 at 2:30 P.M.

Court adjourned at 2:07 P.M.

8:37 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Amy Menzel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Menzel confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with A.D.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Menzel and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Menzel enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 12, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.
